elements.name: Warden Logs present in ES Query

steps.name: I have an ES server running at "http://10.10.1.103:9200"
I query for logs for index "logstash-*"
I see at least a single log containing the word "warden"

elements.name: View First Metrics in Node Dashboard

steps.name: I have a grafana server and port set to "http://10.10.1.103:3000"
it has been populated with reports as described in "installation.feature/Grafana Dashboard Definition Import"
my grafana username is "admin"
my grafana password is "admin"
I have logged into Grafana
I navigate to the node dashboard
I look for the following metrics
I see the corresponding graph with reasonably accurate data for the past 24 hours
my MCS username is "mapr"
my MCS password is "mapr"
my MCS is running at "https://10.10.1.103:8443"
I have an authenticated MCS Rest Client Session
my MCS username is "mapr"
my MCS password is "mapr"
my MCS is running at "https://10.10.1.103:8443"
I have an authenticated MCS Rest Client Session
I am testing against a configured cluster that is expected to be functioning
I use the MCS Rest Client Session to retrieve dashboardInfo
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I do not see any unhealthy spyglass services
my MCS username is "mapr"
my MCS password is "mapr"
my MCS is running at "https://10.10.1.103:8443"
I have an authenticated MCS Rest Client Session
I want to make sure the health check is accurate
I purposely take down collectd on one or more nodes
I ask the dashboardInfo for unhealthySpyglassServices
I see that collectd is in the list within "16" seconds

name: Installation
description:
As a MapR Employee
In order to test and demo Spyglass before it is available in the UI installer
I install Spyglass on top of a previously prepared MapR Cluster

steps.name: the cluster under test is a single node cluster
the cluster under test is a single node cluster
I have manually prepared a single node cluster as described by "single-node-cluster-prep.feature"
the node is running CentOS 7
I read the readme at "https://github.com/mapr/private-spyglass"
it tells me how to install, configure and run the services required for Spyglass
it tells me how to discover the URLs for MCS, Kibana, Grafana, OpenTSDB and ElasticSearch
the cluster under test is a single node cluster
I have manually prepared a single node cluster as described by "single-node-cluster-prep.feature"
the node is running Ubuntu 12.04
I read the readme at "https://github.com/mapr/private-spyglass"
it tells me how to install, configure and run the services required for Spyglass
it tells me how to discover the URLs for MCS, Kibana, Grafana, OpenTSDB and ElasticSearch
the cluster under test is a single node cluster
I have manually prepared a single node cluster as described by "single-node-cluster-prep.feature"
the node is running SUSE 12
I read the readme at "https://github.com/mapr/private-spyglass"
it tells me how to install, configure and run the services required for Spyglass
it tells me how to discover the URLs for MCS, Kibana, Grafana, OpenTSDB and ElasticSearch
the cluster under test is a single node cluster
I have automatically prepared a single node cluster as described by "single-node-cluster-prep.feature"
the node is running CentOS 7
I prepare it using automation described by "single-node-cluster-prep.feature"
I run the Spyglass installer
I subsequently run the health check described by "health-check.feature"
the health check passes

elements.name: View Warden Log in Discovery Tab

steps.name: I have a kibana instance running at "http://10.10.1.103:5601"
I navigate to kibana's discovery interface
I see at least one log from warden
my MCS username is "mapr"
my MCS password is "mapr"
my MCS is running at "https://10.10.1.103:8443"
I have an authenticated MCS Rest Client Session
I ask for a link to grafana
I receive a URL to grafana
a GET request of the URL does not return an error status code

elements.name: Getting Simple Node Metrics via REST API

steps.name: the URL and port of OpenTSDB is "http://10.10.1.103:4242"
I specify the query range start as "1h-ago"
I query for the following metrics:
I receive at least "200" values per metric covering that time period
those values may be incorrect but we are only testing for presence

name: Single Node Cluster Preparation
description:
As a MapR Employee
In order to test and demo Spyglass before it is available in the UI installer
I prepare a Single Node MapR Cluster with the prerequisites documented in private/spyglass readme
